ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] re: Fascinating article
ygData.msgSnippet: Speaking of interacting and stuff, I starting doing my vp key quest, i m not very far in it, I was camping pained soul (which turned out to be me after a few
ygData.messageBody:
Speaking of interacting and stuff, I starting doing my vp key quest, i'm not
very far in it, I was camping pained soul (which turned out to be me after a
few hours, and I'm still not done there). Anyways, I got a few mantrap root
or something while I was there (which have an icon of a flower).

Time goes by, we go do Doze in tov, and our resident mage always hands me a
modrod as soon as I get there, but this time I gave her the flowers in
exchange, needless to say she was very surprised, but hey, it put a smile on
her face, which is all good. There was nothing about it, it was simply a
friendly gesture.

Minkin
RIP
A Ro

-----Original Message-----
From: Kenneth E. Bachman [mailto:kbachman@...]
Sent: February 25, 2002 12:49 AM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] re: Fascinating article


Most of my alts are female (wanna make something of it?), and I have to
agree with Wendy. Not only are
there a lot of players in this game who don't know how to relate to women,
there are some players in this
game I really think should be locked up for the safety of their female
townsfolk.

Kenross Cantoforjado, Virtuoso (I'm thinking retired?) of Innoruuk



"Cranfill, Wendy" wrote:

> A-freaking-men!
>
> For an even more frightening study, do a survey of the types of remarks
real
> women get in tells while playing this game. While I know there are any
> number of "normal" men playing this game (at least I hope).. there is a
> disturbing number of men with absolutely NO idea of how to interact
socially
> with women. Frightening. And yes, I am prepared for the flames from the
> overgeneralized, stereotyping remark I have just made. Someday though, I
> will have to compile my screenshots for some amusement!
>
> Halana/Tani
